All Classes and Interfaces|All Packages

D

distance() - Method in class LinearCalculator
Returns the distance of two points with any coordinates, calculated by adding both squares of the positive difference of the values of both axes and then square rooting all of that, then rounding to the nearest hundredths place

E

equation() - Method in class LinearCalculator
Returns a String that includes the equation of the slope of the line of the two points

G

getX1() - Method in class LinearCalculator
Returns the current value of the first x coordinate.
getX2() - Method in class LinearCalculator
Returns the current value of the second x coordinate.
getY1() - Method in class LinearCalculator
Returns the current value of the first y coordinate.
getY2() - Method in class LinearCalculator
Returns the current value of the second y coordinate.

L

LinearCalculator - Class in Unnamed Package
This class represents a Linear Calculator object
LinearCalculator(String, String) - Constructor for class LinearCalculator
Instantiates a LinearCalculator object.

P

printInfo() - Method in class LinearCalculator
Returns a String that includes values of the two points, the equation, the slope, the y-intercept, and the distance of the two points

R

roundedToHundredth(double) - Method in class LinearCalculator
Private helper method that rounds a value to the nearest hundredths place by multiplying the value by 100, calling Math.round, and then dividing the value by 100

S

setX1(int) - Method in class LinearCalculator
Sets the value of the first x coordinate to a new value.
setX2(int) - Method in class LinearCalculator
Sets the value of the second x coordinate to a new value.
setY1(int) - Method in class LinearCalculator
Sets the value of the first y coordinate to a new value.
setY2(int) - Method in class LinearCalculator
Sets the value of the second y coordinate to a new value.
slope() - Method in class LinearCalculator
Returns the slope of the two points, calculated by dividing the change in x by the change in y

Y

yInt() - Method in class LinearCalculator
Returns the value of the y-intercept based on the line the two points make when connected, calculated by getting the first y coordinate and subtracting the slope multiplied by the first x coordinate from it, then rounding to the nearest hundredths place.
